page.title: 11ENERGY
page.content: {BLINDWELLS OPEN CAST MINE }- The site lies one mile east of {TRANENT.}In 1978 after many test borings were taken from the surrounding area it was decided that the Blindwells site had one of the best yields.Production target is 5.01m tonnes to be reached in 1986/7.As with all coal sites the area is acquired,prospected and leased by the N.C.B.The site is situated above several seams of coal of varying thickness and determined by the N.C.B. to be economically viable.The total workforce is 135. 30% of these people are from Tranent - no local miners are employed.The labour force is small by comparison to deep mining and this method of winning coal requires few of the traditional deep mining skills. The land must be restored to the same condition after production finishes.
